Reviews.Title: “great place to relax and regroup”
Reviews.Author: Brenda_Carlos
Reviews.Content: My husband Carlos and I stayed for several nights way back in approx 2000. It was one of your first years of operation. I see that you have only made it more beautiful and lush. My first and lasting impression was that of comfort. We felt welcomed even though we were travel weary when we arrived. We really enjoyed our stay in Playa, but your hotel was one of the main reasons. Thanx.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: WSCTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 6 blocks from the beach and is only 3 blocks from all the shops at "5th avenue" The hotel is very clean, very quiet. Refrigerated air conditioning and ceiling fans keep the room confortable. Just a two blocks to wal mart and within walking distance to some great restaurants. They have coffee and other breakfast items, although not a full breaktfast for about $3.00. Staff is very friendly and very helpful. Hotel has a small pool and the courtyard is a very relaxing place to be. Far enough away from the tourist area to be quiet yet close enough that a quick walk and you will be in the thick of the tourist zone. Also close to several internet cafes and laundries.

Reviews.Title: “good value in a quiet location in bustling playa”
Reviews.Author: ajax71
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights straight off an 11 hr flight to Cancun . About 50 mins transfer by taxi at night ($75) which was organised by the hotel to meet us. Very good value for what you get . The website photos are accurate a lovely hacienda style patio garden off which lead the rooms. All rooms have a patio or balcony table & chairs outside . The rooms are well maintained with good working shower & comfortable beds with a mexican character. room fridge for own wine/water etc. Breakfast is a simple choice of coffee /tea, juice & a choice of two tea cakes plus toast included in the price. Its a few blocks back from 5th Avenue which means its quieter, a few local shops for coke & water nearby and not a long walk from the action we walked through town in the morning to Marmitas & the next door Kool beach clubs around calle 28 from the hotel (4-6 calle). We ate at Buenos Aires steak house which is near by & the Glasshouse Rest by Hotel Deseo which we enjoyed. Paid in USD cash on arrival, request & confirmation by email was efficient. A place with charater not right on the beach but that didnt bother us (as you can deceide on your own beach clubs) for a few nights at the start of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: blkimmel
Reviews.Content: After my husband and I had been bounced to two different hotels in a miserable experience with an over booked hotel, we stumbled into Casa de las Flores. The staff were extremely nice and helpful. They were able to book us at a reasonable price on short notice. The room was very nicely accomodated with plenty of room. The ONLY down fall of this hotel was an occasional sewer smell. It was easly taken care of by shutting the bathroom door, turning on the fan and opening the bathroom window. The bed was comfortable and breakfast consisted of coffee cakes, cereal and orange juice/coffee. We did have problems connecting to the internet, but the staff worked really hard to solve those issues. It is a little of the strip, which we enjoyed, because it made us explore some other areas. I would go back to this hotel in an instant. Thank you for a great ending to our trip Casa de las Flores!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and pretty hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: jenita99
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 3 days over the 09/10 new year and really enjoyed it. It's not on the main strip near the beach but it's only 5 or so mins walk away, which is great because it's not in a noisy area. The rooms are very sweet and Mexican, great shower and well set up. Everythig is very clean and services well, and the staff are very lovely and helpful. The room we happened to be in i think was part of a 2-room suite perhaps, because the only bad thing was that we could hear the loud voices of the people next door very clearly, and their banging around. I don't think most of their rooms are set up like this, so just check.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed, nice, clean, cheap, private and close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: chinnofy
Reviews.Content: Avery nice hotel to stay at if you do not plan to stay much in your room. Casa de las Flores is nicely decorated, three blocks from downtown, comfortable and clean rooms nice but not luxurious, excelent if you want to have fun all over the riviera :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, charming hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PhilR_007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Casa de las Flores a few days ago and can highly recommend it to anyone looking to get away from the crowds of tourists and late night noise of Playa Del Carmen. Playa is quite a busy, noisy place - which is great if thats what you're looking for, but not if you need an early night (Jet-lagged Europeans take note!!). We stayed in the awful 'Hotel Labnah' in the centre and it was so filthy and noisy we moved hotel; we tried the Barrio Latino as we'd stayed there a few weeks earlier (can recommend this hotel too!), but it was full and were recommended the Hotel Casa de las Flores. The charming staff and airy & bright rooms absolutely saved the end of our holiday, for which I'm eternally grateful! The room (24) was really nicely decorated, had the best shower in Mexico and, most importantly, was very clean. I've read reviews of this place saying it was noisy (I read one review where someone complained about birdsong - hilarious... damn those evil birds!!); I didn't hear a peep out of dogs etc... maybe I'm just a heavy sleeper, but I wasn't disturbed by anything. The girl on reception made us feel really welcome, she even came out of the office to come and have a chat with my girlfriend who was waiting in the courtyard with our bags; which I thought was a nice touch. We also spoke to (who I think was) the owner/manager - who again was very friendly and approachable. The breakfast could do to include a few more items; as it was just cake, coffee & juice, but outside of that I have zero complaints. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants peace and quite in charming surroundings and who doesn't mind a 5 minute walk to the main drag. PS. If you like frog statues, then you won't be disappointed with this hotel!! ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Service. Buenísimo!”
Reviews.Author: Aledrije
Reviews.Content: The service was very good, we have not complaints at all. The room was clean and simple but kind of cozy. The only thing that was a bit slow was the toilet, that took a while to fill up again, but we didn't have a real problem with that. The hotel is quiet enough. I didn't hear a thing at night and nothing woke me up. In fact, I had the best night sleep I've had in months. The location is good, 3 blocks away from the beach and 2 from 5th avenue. There are lots of restaurants and food stands nearby. You can buy juice, fruit and cheese and meat empanadas if you're used to have a big breakfast. If you aren't, the hotel offers a basic one: coffee, juice and bread (mexican sweet bread), pretty good too. The staff and the owners are very kind and helpful, that made me feel very comfortable. There's free wireless at the lobby and a small pool and hammocks. It's so good! Thanks to all the staff, we had a great time at Playa and surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “great spot!”
Reviews.Author: CindyRome
Reviews.Content: I suggest this hotel for a stay in Playa del Carmen great spot: clean, nice, quiet and faraway from noise...but 10 minutes walking form la Quinta avenida and from beach!!! cindyrome

Reviews.Title: “quiet elegance”
Reviews.Author: Jakebrake
Reviews.Content: After bouncing around southern Mexico for a few weeks stayed at Casa de las flores on our last night before flying out. This place was the same great quality and fair price i remembered from a few years back. we stayed in room #8 if you want the most quiet stay in the back around that area a few dollars more but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not that quiet...”
Reviews.Author: Melbi
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because the review was saying it was really quiet.... Considering that you hear dogs barking non-stop days and nights, roaster starting to sing at 4am, birds singing at 5 am, the doors are really difficult to close, so you have to bang them, there is absolutely no insonorisation between the room, so pray to have quiet neighbors because you will hear all their conversation!! So considering all this, for me it's not a quiet hotel... Location was good, room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “not a accomadating hotel”
Reviews.Author: cintiasbox
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my kids at this hotel was ok but had some problems with toilet. also ask for a bedcot ,owner or manager was not accomodating. idont recommend this hotel for family

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: magpie15
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Playa del Carmen with no booking, but had marked a few places in the Lonely Planet guide - Casa de las Flores was the first one we tried and we were delighted to find they had room. There were 4 of us, so we had 2 rooms. We got the slightly better rooms which had fridges. This was very handy as we could buy water, beer and fruit in the corner shop opposite and there was no problem bringing food from outside into the hotel, unlike some places. The hotel is like a little oasis in the older part of town - description of rooms and gardens are accurate. Everything is very convenient and cheaper than in the more fashionable part of town - laundry, restaurants, internet - and you are living in the real Mexico, not in a gated resort. We are quite talkative people and easily got into conversation with the receptionist and later the owner, with whom we had several interesting conversations. The receptionist was very helpful, assisting us to book a hotel in Vallodolid, our next stop. When some rain came under the door of one of our rooms during a thunderstorm, the owner sorted it our herself, very promptly. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you want a quiet, relatively cheap place to stay in a popular holiday resort.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Pleasant, Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: FromArlingtonVA
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Casa del Flores and thought it was adorable. The room was perhaps the largest hotel room I've ever had with large windows and a very pleasant, simple decor set in a wonderful little courtyard. The outstanding feature is the detail put into decorating and housekeeping. After a five hour bus ride we smiled when we opened our room to find that someone had taken the time to fold the towels in the shape of a swan. I'm writing this review mainly because we were nervous after some of the reviews we read online. The owner did hang out in the reception/lounge area (this is her home, afterall), but she was helpful and friendly. It is run much more like a little European gasthaus than a 500 room Marriott with a professional concierge. Several other reviewers complained that the beach towels the hotel provided were tiny. They must have seen this and made amends, because the ones they gave us were enormous. (really too large) The pool is pretty and tiny -- more of a decoration than a place to swim. We swam in the ocean instead. The casa is located on an uninviting street about 5 blocks from the beach. Instead of a 3 minute walk to the beach at the pricey hotels, it's more like 7 mins. This was the lowest price place we could find on short notice, and we were very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “This Casa is not My Casa!”
Reviews.Author: Sez1982
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 week holiday in Playa yesterday- we spent the second leg of it at 'Casa'. We booked this accomodation several months beforehand and were very much looking forward to it. Upon arrival we were left in the reception for a good 10mins whilst the owner sat in the reception room gossiping with another lady. Checking in was the only contact we had with the owner, not so much as a smile from her after that, even after several attempts on our part. Many days we were only left 1 bathroom towel and 1 tiny handtowel. Not good when there are 2 of you trying to dry off! The pool also looked like it hadnt been cleaned in a while, I felt I was swimming in fly puree during my one and only dip. On the plus side, the rooms are very spacious and cool, the gardens are beautiful and it is very peacful. To be honest though I dont think Id book to visit here again, its really weird but you kind of get the feeling your 'not wanted'.

Reviews.Title: “Bothered - not!”
Reviews.Author: rosceite
Reviews.Content: Mixed up in a mixed up place, Playa del Carmen , from La Perla wearing modelesques to dreadlock mayhem. Now for the accomodation, on the plus side, very clean, very quiet, if your variation of quiet extends to the only interaction with the owner/manager is to hand over your money, you will love this.In fact this is usually my style, but aside from the invisible people who clean your room and water the attractive garden, this is the first place I have ever stayed in where you managed to feel an intruder (owners/friends hanging around the lobby holding bored sounding private conversations without even a buenos dias/tardes) . I felt less of an intruder when I had to sleep in a childs bedroom in Asia when the place I was staying was overbooked. Huge sense of ennui from this place, like the owners just want to pay their bills under sufferance while the guests need to be either invisible or of sufficently glamourous quality to deign notice. As a not old and not that young European I can vouch that the same qualities mentioned in other posts are not confined to statesiders. Plus side, very near to collectivo stop for Tulum and or Cancun which is a very definite plus, and in a genuine neighbourhood which I am sure passes by many others in hotels in more beachside locations. If you are seeking the new and the minimal things seem to have moved well to the north in Playa leaving this side of town to be recolonised by those who originally had it and some real tack close on ave 5.

Reviews.Title: “Very good ratio price/quality”
Reviews.Author: xav75017
Reviews.Content: Casa de Las Flores is a very nice hotel to stay in Playa. There are a few rooms in a quiet ambiance. You'll be 4 blocks from the main street (to the east), and a few streets from the "good" part of the 5th avenue (the part with less tourist's boutiques but more bars+restaurants), so you will not be really in the inside downtown => you'll have to walk a little bit, but you'll be really quiet, wich is really high advantage in Playa. Avoid room 13 : the air conditionning is very noisy, and if you switch it off, you will still hear the AC of the room 1, just below !! We have changed the second day of our trip for an other room, without balcony but much more nice (new AC, room renovated). The swimming pool is nice and clean. You'll have price for a beach club (about 1km), the mamita's (30 pesos/day). ++ best ratio price/quality ++ quiet ++ clean ++ nice italian management

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed (again)...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although Casa de las Flores is a beautiful, hacienda-style accomodation, I was sadly disappointed that I paid $75 a night for a room that had one postage sized 'bath' towel--no hand towel, no washcloth, one tiny bar of soap, no shampoo or conditioner, NO DRINKING GLASSES! No joke! I had to buy one at a store to take my daily medication. The woman running the establishment is sassy indeed. I'm not sure if she dislikes Americans in general, but I found her condescending and really unhelpful. I was travelling with my sister who is older, and upon checkout I asked if she could call a cab as my sister had trouble carrying her bags. She refused and told us to walk to the end of the block and hail a taxi ourselves. I was highly offended. And all this for $75.00 a night. What is most ironic is I'd been to Casa de las Flores in 2004 and had a similar experience. I decided to return because it was familiar and hoped the experience would be a better one. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “This is great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rosweed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this little place about 5 minutes from the beach. Beatriz, the owner, and Paula, the manager, are delightful people. The photos don't do it justice. I think it's grown to 24 or 28 rooms now. We stayed in #11 (king size bed!)on the ground floor and in the new addition. In fact, we may have been the first people to stay in the room. We stayed at Christmas, so the rates were higher than they ususally are. But they were still a bargain for a boutique hotel of this quality. I highly recommend it because it's small, personal, and away from the noise and hustle and bustle of 5th Avenue. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Flores B&B”
Reviews.Author: tomgyakima
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Casa Flores in Ajijic on two occasions in Nov and Dec 2005. There are only 5 rooms, all distinctive. The first time we were in Room 3, very spacious with a garden sitting area outside the room. The second visit was in Room 4, upstairs with a commanding view of the mountains. Casa Flores is only 3 blocks from the square and the same distance from a half dozen good restaurants. The breakfasts were very good as well. There is a pool as well. The rates are reasonable at between $50 and $65 per night for two people. Jean and Walt Smith are very accomodative. Their website is www.casafloresmexico.com

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Casa de las Flores”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stumbled across this beautiful, family-run hotel after deciding to check-out of yet another over-rated, over-priced hotel on the Lonely Planet circuit. Feel in love with the place on sight - so decided to stay for a fortnight whilst I studied Spanish at a nearby school. Bucket loads of character - truly beautiful, spotlessly clean, amazingly friendly staff - including the super-sassy owner / manager (Beatrice). And it's CHEAP!! I paid only US$25 per night for a very comfortable basic room for 10 days - with a great view over the pool and courtyard. Whadda bargain!! The place is tucked away in the authentically Mexican part of town - which adds to the charm - just around the corner from the sorry precession of tired old-haunts recommended in the little green tourist bible (for which I am increasingly loosing respect for). It's a few blocks back from the beach, and thankfully a million miles from the tourist pack that descends on Avenida Qunita. If I were heading back to Playa any time soon, I'd be keeping this one all to myself. But I'm not. So I feel it's only fair to share. And plus, I owe Beatrice the favour of a strong recommendation. She looked after me like I can't begin to explain. It's her hotel. And it shows. (Did I mention the night she brought in the local 12 piece Mariachi band and kept us all well lubricated with Tequila around the pool). POSITIVELY BRILLIANT!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Casa de las Flores
